page.title: 08FARMING IN GOOSTREY
page.content: {FARMING IN THE GOOSTREY AREA} Most of the farms are dairy farms. To the north of the area there are many fairly small farms of less than 50 acres, rented from Cheshire County Council. This land was divided up for rent after the First World War. The most common breed of cow is Friesian. The herds vary in size from 38 to 100 milking cows. The smaller farms all use artificial insemination or else rent a bull. One large farm has its own bull. Non-productive cows and bull calves are sent to Chelford Market. Most of the land is managed grassland. Potatoes and barley are the most common cash crops. The farms all have two or more tractors. The other machinery owned varies from farm to farm. Contractors' machinery is used for large specialised jobs.
